file_content.text: There are still so many... I'm going to need more explosives.
Set the charges around the nest, then hunt down their queen.
Where are you? Come out! I know you're there, you brain-stealing vermin! Oh! Uh... sorry. I didn't see you.
Captain Ascercia of House Thul. Can't speak now, got to keep an eye out. Killiks are everywhere....
They'll turn us all into mindless drones to serve in their hives. They must be stopped!
I lack the patience to listen to your raving. Just tell me what's going on.
Stop ranting and speak sense.
My lord, the Killiks are a menace! Giant insects that can take control of your thoughts! And they are spreading.
I hardly see what it matters if this miserable planet is overrun by Killiks.
Let them.
They control your mind, my lord! They'll worm their way into your brain, too....
You looking to hire me for some bug-stomping?
Sounds like a job offer to me.
I knew you'd understand! You want to kill them, too, don't you?
There are plenty of bigger threats on Alderaan than the Killiks. Why are you so worried?
That doesn't seem likely.
Why aren't you worried? There are countless Killiks out there just looking for a way to dig into your mind....
You think they're going to keep spreading?
Are they a serious threat?
Their numbers increase daily. They're trying to burrow into my thoughts, I know it....
Scared of a few bugs?
There are bugs on this planet twice the size of men, who can steal your mind! You don't find that unsettling?
When they overrun our world, House Thul will be powerless to aid the Empire!
I've got demolition charges. We can strap them to the Killik hive to draw their queen out of hiding! Help me!
Give me the charges.
Explosives? To kill bugs?
I'm the only sane one left! The only one who knows what the monsters are up to!
Attach the charges, then seek the queen. Tell my commander we succeeded.
Kill them all. Kill them with fire!
You've snapped. [Refuse quest]
They'll cover this planet with their hives, and then you'll see....
Did you see that? Was it a Killik? This place is crawling with bugs....
Captain, maybe you should look over our battle plans again. I can handle the debriefing.
Please, forgive the captain. He hasn't been the same since the Imperial squad we were traveling with was attacked by the Killiks.
We were their field guides, helping to install a long-range sensor array. Prototype technology, all the way from Dromund Kaas.
The Killiks overwhelmed us. The Imperials had the sensors on their backs. The Killiks...attached them to their hives.
Attached them how?
The men were cocooned. Some kind of sticky, woven material. More Killik filth.
You're crazy too.
I know what I saw. The men were cocooned, wrapped up and stuck to the hive.
I don't have all day.
Don't you get it? Those men were put in cocoons. Now the Killiks have our sensors.
Ever since, I've been working on a way to get even. Now I have it-- these liquid grenades. Special formula, dissolves the cocoons on contact.
With these grenades, we could get those sensors, avenge those men, and win this war. But with the captain's...illness, I can't leave him alone.
Say no more, friend.
Thank you. House Thul will owe you a great debt if you make it out alive.
Where are the sensors?
The Killik hives are just over this ridge. The men and the sensors are...well, you won't miss them.
If you get yourself and the sensors out, take them to Major Pharoth, our CO at Outpost Bolym.
Maybe the captain will improve when he hears what you're doing. Good luck out there.
Your problem. [Refuse quest]
Just be careful out there, then. The captain and I have seen what the Killiks can do.
